node.title: North Korea Defector Captured After Being on the Run for 40 Days
node.description: Online video footage shows a man believed to be Zhu Xianjian being carried away by four police officers.

node.title: Who Is Alison Nathan? Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Judge
node.description: The Manhattan federal judge is overseeing the sex abuse trial of Ghislaine Maxwell in the U.S. district court.

node.title: Portuguese football team reports possible first cases of Omicron community transmission outside of southern Africa
node.description: A professional soccer club may have the first cases of community transmission of the Omicron variant of COVID-19 that is seeing international borders slam closed once again.

node.title: Trailblazing and internationally acclaimed, David Dalaithngu walked tall in two cultures
node.description: His career spanned nearly 50 years and took Indigenous Australia to the world, but now Northern Territory actor David Dalaithngu AM has died.

node.title: Looking at Surrealist Art in Our Own Surreal Age
node.description: When viewed as a vehicle for various forms of liberation, the movement remains highly resonant even a century after its heyday.

node.title: Merriam-Webster picks its 2021 word of the year
node.description: The U.S. dictionary of record says lookups for the word increased 1,048% this year, and it's a word that "really represents two different stories."

node.title: Greg Abbott Remarks About South Africa Migrants 'Crossing Border' Prompts Widespread Derision
node.description: Social media users accuse the Texas governor of confusing the country of South Africa with the continent of South America.

node.title: Novak Djokovic's dad claims his son will likely skip Australian Open over vaccine mandate
node.description: There is further doubt over whether the men's world number one will compete at Melbourne Park, with his dad likening Tennis Australia's stance on player vaccination to "blackmail".

node.title: Actor David Dalaithngu dies aged 68
node.description: David Dalaithngu AM was a pioneering actor as well as dancer, singer and painter.

node.title: ¿Tener hijos o no tenerlos?, he ahí un dilema
node.description: En un mundo de caos pandémico, conflictos políticos y catástrofes climáticas, algunos aspirantes a padres ven el futuro demasiado sombrío como para ampliar la familia.

node.title: Joaquina Kalukango and Amanda Williams on Creative Freedom
node.description: The “Slave Play” actress and the Chicago-based artist discuss generational gaps, success and the art that brought them each acclaim.

node.title: The Packers Use Familiar Hands to Best the New-Look Rams
node.description: Green Bay’s Aaron Rodgers relied on veterans to beat the Rams, who had stockpiled talented stars like Von Miller and Odell Beckham Jr. to contend for the N.F.C. title.

node.title: 14 Killer Exercises to Strengthen Your Core
node.description: Core fitness affects your balance, posture and stability.

node.title: As Highly Mutated Omicron COVID Variant Spreads, Should Americans Be Worried?
node.description: Experts spoke to Newsweek about the new variant that has been classified as a variant of concern by the World Health Organization.

node.title: Labrador's Reaction After Owners Discover It Chewed Defrosting Turkey Goes Viral
node.description: The Labrador looked guiltily at the defrosting bird, which had two massive bite marks in it.

node.title: A ‘Simpsons’ Episode Lampooned Chinese Censorship. In Hong Kong, It Vanished.
node.description: The episode mocked both Mao Zedong and the government’s efforts to suppress memory of the 1989 Tiananmen Square massacre.

node.title: Omicron COVID Variant Symptoms Compared to Delta, Other Forms of the Virus
node.description: The South African doctor who first reported the Omicron variant says she noticed two common symptoms were missing from patients with this form of coronavirus.

node.title: No, the Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Does Not Have a Gag Order
node.description: Several social media posts have claimed that members of the press have been barred from accessing the courtroom.

node.title: Sea Lion Caught by Police After Going for Wander Around Oregon City
node.description: The sea lion was spotted in Lincoln City after swimming up the river and making its way through a neighbourhood.

node.title: Actor David Gulpilil has died aged 68
node.description: Pioneering Indigenous actor David Gulpilil Ridjimiraril Dalaithngu dies aged 68.

node.title: The Latest on Omicron
node.description: What should you assume about the new variant?

node.title: Portugal detects 13 cases of Omicron tied to a soccer team.
node.description: The team, Belenenses, took part in a game that had to be abandoned after a Covid outbreak reduced the number of eligible players. One infected player had recently returned from South Africa.

node.title: Cardiac Angiosarcoma Symptoms Explained As Virgil Abloh, Off-White Founder, Dies
node.description: The influential fashion designer, 41—who was creative director for Louis Vuitton—had been receiving treatment for the cancer privately for more than two years.

node.title: Lauren Boebert Says Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Will Spur 'Misguided Outrage'
node.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is accused of grooming underage girls to have sex with convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein.

node.title: "Good reason to be worried" as Omicron COVID variant spreads fast
node.description: But South Africa, after quickly detecting and reporting the strain, feels punished for its sound science as other nations slam the door shut.

node.title: Steve Bannon Faces Over 1,000 Pages of Evidence and Materials From Prosecution in Contempt Case
node.description: The Justice Department said it has handed over 65 documents per Bannon's defense team's request, while also accusing them of "frivolous" legal complaints.

node.title: Roe v. Wade Being Overturned Will Harm Black Women the Most
node.description: Mississippi has asked the Supreme Court to overturn the landmark 1973 ruling in a case seeking to revive a 15-week abortion ban.

node.title: Fears workers will not get paid as bubble tea chain accused of wage theft enters liquidation
node.description: Two months after the Fair Work Ombudsman launches legal action against the operators of Fun Tea, the company is placed into liquidation.

node.title: What Is a ‘Comfort Creator’?
node.description: Move over, “Friends.” Turn off “The Office.” The new comforting media is streamers.

node.title: As World Shuts Borders to Stop Omicron, Japan Offers a Cautionary Tale
node.description: Japan, which has been very cautious throughout the pandemic, is again barring all nonresident foreigners. There is an economic and human cost.
